author: julynb57
title: My vasectomy!
body:
Just wanted to thank Dr Prevost and his colleague Jen for making my vasectomy experience as comfortable as it could be. I was very nervous but between them they made me laugh and distracted me at all the right moments. It was over before I'd realised it was done. Thank you!  
I was also really impressed by how responsive Dr Prevost was in the after care. Thank you!

author: exserviceuser
title: Nottingham Recovery College
body:
For the most part, this service was great. I’d never attended anything like it. It takes an educational approach to coping mechanisms, dealing with situations and learning about types of mental disorders. It involves a lot of group work, but there is no pressure or judgement and the teaching staff were fun, engaging and understanding.  
Unfortunately, my time there was cut short because of the pandemic starting in the middle of my first term there. Understandably, the college had to shut. However, I then received absolutely no communication from them whatsoever. No updates, no forwarding of resources to help us continue things at home, no checking in to see how we were doing. Not even a message or letter etc to encourage us to contact them if we needed someone to speak to. This was particularly disheartening as it was a programme that encouraged looking out for each other and supporting each other. They had our contact details, and a lot of people relied on this service for structure, a reason to get out of the house and interact with people, a useful tool in helping them cope with life. Yet there was nothing to help us in the pandemic. Thankfully, I did not rely on this service heavily enough for the lack of contact to have a huge detrimental affect on my life, but I know a lot of others did and I really hope the lack of support did not cause them too much distress. It was quite sad to think it was all an act, that they didn’t really care at all and as soon as there was a reason to wash their hands off us completely without the repercussions of us being there to react in front of them, they took it. I know it’s probably not as deep as that, but it certainly felt like it. Especially given the nature of people that use this service, it was rather insensitive and disappointing for us to be left with nothing, to be cut off so abruptly.

author: mhairic
title: The great care my dad received in Ward 24
body:
My very elderly father was admitted to Glasgow Royal Infirmary with pneumonia. He was seen in A&E and was admitted to ward 50.  
From A&E through to the ward the medical and nursing staff kept us informed throughout about what was happening with him as we were obviously not allowed to be with him. My mum was allowed to see him that night and the next day as he was extremely ill and it was possible that he wouldn’t survive. That was handled very sensitively by the doctor who was on that night.  
He pulled through against all expectations and was transferred to Ward 24. The staff both medical and nursing were excellent at keeping us in touch with regard to his progress. Once the infection was under control he had delirium and his mobility was badly affected. The delirium made him very agitated and he was constantly looking for my mum.  
The Charge nurse assessed that for his well-being it was important that he be able to see my mum (who is very elderly herself) and allowed her and I to visit as he was in a single room and with appropriate care we could reduce the risks. This helped him enormously.  
I was so impressed with the high standard of nursing care in the ward, both with regards to his physical and mental health. Knowing that he was being looked after by such professional and caring people, made what was a very difficult situation for us as a family so much easier. I cannot praise them highly enough.  
My dad was transferred to Ward 4 in Lightburn and although we haven’t been able to see him the communication has been great and his discharge is planned for next week. The OT Karen has been so helpful in helping us prepare for his arrival home. I just want to say a massive thank you to all the staff that cared for my dad in any capacity. It means the world to us!

readBy.name: Yorkshire & Humber Patient Safety Research Collaboration
Office of John Mason, MSP for Glasgow Shettleston

author: suz58
title: Keeping in touch with family
body:
My father and mother married for well over 60 years became increasingly distressed by the circumstances in which they found themselves - in different hospital wards in the Queen Elizabeth and the New Victoria in Glasgow with minimal communication between them for months.  
Trying to ask for help from staff to facilitate a phone or video call was challenging not least because of the number of attempts made before the phone was answered or a response made to email request. Staff offer to help but managing never ending phone calls, requests for video calls and clinical care cannot be easy.Is it unreasonable to expect an organisational response to the basic human need for social contact with family?Having received a call from staff one evening to let us know how distressed my father had become in being so detached from his wife I was moved to to complain about his mental wellbeing care needs.A response was swift and well received. My father's care plan includes a minimum weekly call between he and my mother facilitated by staff. A zoom call took place on their 63rd wedding anniversary in January 2021 I think we all wept.Please support our nurses and doctors to care for our families.

title: Amazing Staff
body: The family wanted to say a huge thank you to all the staff who are working 12 hour shifts at the weekends to provide the COVID vaccine. Everyone from the volunteers, nurses admin staff and doctors were amazing working tirelessly to provide the vaccine and protect our most vulnerable. Despite the venue not being the largest, compared to the large hubs, they were protecting us before the national rollout and before many other surgeries. Yes, we waited and outside in January weather but the staff were working flat out and could not be more professional and the atmosphere inside was very calming with lots of laughter. Both Grandads 94 and 90 who both live with us are still talking about the visits and how grateful they are to have had the vaccines. So from all of us a huge thank you and please look after yourselves and your families.

title: Covid vaccine great experience
body: A mammoth task undertaken, i was on their 3rd day but the system was sleek and organised. Staff were friendly and professional. Awesome job in challenging situation

title: Excellent service
body: My concerns were dealt with in a timely, efficient, and safe manner. I was able to talk to a gp about my concerns and as expected, I received an advise and more confirmatory blood tests and other tests on the day.

title: Efficient and friendly
body: My experiences cover several visits. I have in the last year transferred my medical care to this practice and have been very impressed with the efficient handling of my care. Nothing has been missed. They are very accommodating when I need last minute blood tests, etc. Records are updated very quickly. The team are friendly and welcoming. Thank you.

author: distraught wife
title: Awful care for 48hrs in A&E / excellent care in A3
body:
Sorry this is going to be a long one!!!!  
My husband had covid and on the last day of isolation he deteriorated. Our GP advised us to ring the 'call first number' at AAH. We were given an appointment for assessment at the covid rapid assessment unit. The doctor and nurses that seen to my husband at this stage were very helpful and explained everything well. We were told after a chest xray that things were bad - he had pneumonia and would need admitted for IVABs and steroids. I was grateful for the explanation, an d was scared for him as left him and went to get him an overnight bag. On arrival at A&E again, a nurse came to take his stuff and explained which antibiotics etc he was on which was great.  
However, that is where I can honestly say the good care ended for the rest of the 48 hours he spent in A&E awaiting a bed on the ward. To cut a very long story short I feel he was treated extremely poorly. He text me to say his oxygen mask was changed but wasn't told how much oxygen he was requiring. He sent me a picture and as a nurse myself, I knew from it that things were pretty bad. The following morning he said it was changed again and again sent me a picture. You can imagine how worried I was not being able to visit and my husband not being able to give me any details. I rang for an update. I was told the nurse was busy and to ring back in half hour - fair enough. I rang back and was told this time to ring my husband for an update as they were too busy to talk to me. I find this greatly unacceptable as my husband wasn't told anything and his oxygen levels dropped every time he removed his mask. After a further hour or so of worry and anxiety, I rang and asked for a senior nurse - they answered and again told me to call my husband. I explained that he didn't know anything. I asked how much oxygen he was requiring and what was the plan. The nurse told me that they didn't know as they were in charge and not looking after him. I had to beg them to find out for me. I found this extremely unacceptable communication with a worried family member. The same thing happened the next day when I again rang for an update - I was told to ring back and then told on the 2nd call to ring my husband as the department was 'mental'. I don't feel I rang too many times - once a day i feel is acceptable (had my call been answered!)Aside from the terrible communication from staff in a&e, basic care was missing. The first full day, he wasn't given any lunch despite me being told on the 2nd phone call that he was eating lunch and was talking on the phone - lies as he couldn't speak with the mask on and couldn't manage without it. About an hour later he txt to ask me what time lunch was usually at? This is not acceptable with any patient but especially a diabetic patient. I had to inform the nurse in charge about this when talking to them so that he would be fed! I have since found out that all his meals were left on a tray on top of a bin lid at the entrance to his room. Apart from disgusting hygiene, this resulted in him having to remove his oxygen mask, make his way across the room and carry his tray back to his bed. He needed to put his mask back on for at least 5 mins prior to eating as he struggled to breathe. As I said before, he was in a&e for 48 hours and was never once offered assistance or equipment (ie a basin) to get washed or even a dish to brush his teeth. This I believe is very basic nursing care and in my opinion on this occasion it was extremely poor / absent. I understand that we are in the middle of a pandemic and the NHS is really struggling (i work in the thick of it too!) but the lack of such basic care such as providing food and hygiene is a disgrace.  
Thank goodness my husband eventually got transferred to a ward (A3) where his care and the communication from staff was excellent. I only needed to ring the ward once during his stay - on the evening he got admitted. The nurse who was looking after him was busy with their patients but the nurse who answered the phone got all the information needed and provided me with a comprehensive update on his care and the plan. My husband was also very well informed of what was happening and was therefore able to update me the rest of the time until discharge. Once on the ward he started to recover fairly quickly. He was well fed and given assistance as and when he required. A massive thank you to the staff on the ward for their diligent care and attention given to my husband. They made the end of his hospital journey much more pleasant than the start of it.

readBy.name: Northern Health and Social Care Trust

title: Great experience
body:
I attended Severn View Practice for my first Covid Vaccination. The clinic was extremely well organised. Staff were very efficient kind and competent and cheerful.The whole experience took just less than 20 minutes including the post vaccination 15 minute wait. 
I was very impressed and would like to express my thanks to all involved

title: Great Care
body: Cannot thank the doctor who I saw today enough! I’m not allowed to mention names but they really put my mind at ease after going in about an issue I’ve been putting off for a while. The care, attention and advice of this doctor made me feel like I had a weight lifted off my shoulders and I genuinely feel like I could speak to them about any issues I may have in the future. I have always been treated well at this GP and would wholeheartedly recommend to anyone in the area, especially students as the doctors seem to be really understanding!

title: Incredibly efficient
body: My husband was called to have his first  C-19 vaccine at Islip Village Hall . I was called a few days later as they had some vaccine remaining there at the end of the day. We found that Hub incredibly well organised. From effective  help  re parking, to a smooth, efficient and kind process through the Hall, checking in, the jab itself and then the waiting area - it was extremely well organised. And must have involved a great deal of hard work from an already hard-pressed team.  Thank you very much. Looking forward to the next visit!

author: lovisto
title: I was told that I am no longer in the system
body: I rang in November to book for cervical screening test a week ago and to my surprise I was told that I amp no longer in the system When I asked why? The receptionist said because I have moved out of the area! ! I said That’s not true I have never moved to any where! ! I felt shocked and angry at the same time. I felt like I have been treated and unfairly and discriminated! ! How can just that happen without any notification! ! Who has the right to decide without my knowledge to remove me from the register? ? How did they make that decision? ?

title: Fantastic Service & Understanding
body:
I have attended this practice since I was a child. Even with all of the stress and regulations in place, the surgery always have time and treat me with respect. 
I have had two telephone consultations this past year and the Doctors were incredibly helpful and supportive. The Reception team are friendly and ensure you get what you need.

title: Excellent Practice
body:
I am extremely grateful with Rutland GP surgery. I have been registered with the surgery for 8 years. I have always been able to secure an emergency appointment on the day needed, and receiving telephone consultations from doctors who really care about me and arrange the necessary hospital appointment and tests.  
Recently I got sick, they have been taking good care of me very well. I received call from my doctors regularly with extremely professional manner including care and respect. I always feel like I have entered a private doctor.
 I really appreciated and benefited from this. My experience was outstanding.

title: Prescription Clerk
body:
Wish to thank the prescription clerk for her extremely quick response for my request for medication,I had ran out of them,due to me taking too many over the last period.
I only sent the request this morning and several minutes later, she had sorted the issue,with me being able to collect medication later today,thank you so much.

author: Mum of C
title: Child's routine operation in lock down
body:
On Christmas Eve I received a call offering my son his operation within a few weeks. I was not expecting this appointment to come through for months and was quite surprise it was going ahead, especially as we are still living with Covid and the restrictions. As the procedure was necessary and would be worse if delayed, I accepted the appointment.  
From that stage on, we could not have been in better hands. The pre-operative assessment was undertaken over the phone by Jane, one of the nurses in the ward. As my son has additional needs was followed up by a further call which went into detail about him and what would help with his experience. Jane was very understanding and not at all judgemental. I felt far more confident in taking my son for the procedure. The call was followed up by a postal pack which would allow my son to take a virtual tour and step by step guide of what would happen to him in hospital. He did not want to watch this but I wish that I had insisted.  
My son was given a Covid test 3 days before the operation. This was simple, quick and easy to access. The results were sent to my mobile phone, reassuring me that he was clear and therefore able to turn up for his appointment on the Monday. We followed all of the guidance in the letters received regarding not eating and prepared a bag with books, a DVD and other essentials. As my son is a little fussy when it comes to food and I understood that he would need to eat before going home, I prepared some snacks I knew he would like. I also made sure to take plenty for myself.  
On arrival we were greeted in such a warm and friendly way despite the masks, sanitising and distancing. My son was given his own room, which I think was part of the reasonable adjustments the hospital had made for him due to his additional needs. This was very welcome as it helped to keep him calm. The team had also provided a Lego set for him to build. Such a lovely touch as he went straight into building it and chatting to Jane. Measurements and observations were undertaken. Each team member involved was equally friendly, approachable and were happy to explain what they were doing and talk about subjects that interested my son and kept him calm.  
When the surgeon came to assess the area that needed operating on, we discussed if it was an essential procedure. Due to the pre-operation consultations being over the phone, it has not been possible for this to be done in person. There was some discussion about the fact that the condition could improve and that the surgeon would understand if we wanted to wait a year. He assured us that this was not going to be a problem and that it had been known to happen. He said he would give us time and return after he had done his first operation of the day. My son and I had plenty of time to discuss the situation and then we were joined by Jane, who encouraged my son's view to be heard. He was clear that he would go ahead and that is the course we took. It was so good to have assistance in hearing his views and know that they were taken seriously by the team. When the surgeon returned, we let him know that we would go ahead.  
Unfortunately when it came to my son going into the room where his aesthetic was to be given, he completely panicked. He would not allow either the mask or the needle near him. The team were calm and patient. They talked to him without pressure or fuss. When it was apparent that he would not comply they moved him back to his room and changed their list. We were then visited again by the nurse and she persuaded him to take a pre-med. She was honest and clear and talked to my son in a direct way. She was also encouraging and supportive.  
The anaesthetists came into my son's room and fitted the device into the back of his hand. He was much more settled with this being done in his room. When they took him into the room which he was to go under in, he became anxious again but went under quickly and I was given reassurance and a time to expect him back. Once in recovery and showing signs of waking, I was called and allowed to sit with him. Again there were two nurses in attendance and they were really pleasant and kind. Once he was fully awake, we returned to his room and he was gently allowed to come around and wake. Many of those involved in his whole procedure came to see how he was doing, his observations were done and the site of the procedure checked.  
Once he had eaten and was ready to be discharged, I was given all of the creams and ointments I needed along with instructions both verbally and in writing of how to care for him at home. My son was taken in a wheelchair and assisted into the car at the front of the hospital and we took him home. He was glad to have gone through with the operation with the help of the loving, caring, patent work of a whole team of people who we cannot thank enough.

readBy.name: Royal Devon University Healthcare NHS Foundation Trust

author: Maeve
title: Contact during Covid
body:
My father-in-law is in Kettering General Hospital. I know the staff are under tremendous pressure, even from the fact that family members cannot visit and so are reliant on numerous phonecalls to the already busy wards.  
Kettering General have a system in place that allows you to email a central address with the patient’s name and ward identified, and they will deliver the email to the patient. I assume that in the instance that the person can’t read the email, the staff will assist. This allows someone that is physically unable to access their own phone to receive almost instant messages of support and in the situation with my family, where we live in Ireland, it has really helped us to communicate.  
Maybe this system exists elsewhere, but thankfully I’ve not had to engage with the hospital other than to work there! If it doesn’t exist in other hospitals, I highly recommend it.  
Many thanks to Kettering General from all of our family.

readBy.name: Kettering General Hospital NHS Foundation Trust

author: Andypn
title: Lack of awareness of ASD and GDD
body:
We had contacted our GP surgery seeking to be put on the register as carers. We have three children with ASD, with our youngest also having a GDD and requiring wheelchair services. The GP believes however that as parents we don't need to do any more to care for our children than anyone else.  
Two of our children are assessed for DLA with one receiving high rate care and mobility, and the other receiving low rate for both, we are still in the process of applying for our oldest. This yet again is an example to GPs, who have little to do with the care of the children due to being under Specialist Children's Services, showing no understanding of neurological disorders and the care needs involved. The GP has therefore refused to put us on the carers register. Disgusted by this service from a family surgery who were unwilling to make referrals to Specialist Children's Services in the first place.

author: Treatment
title: Sad to have received the care I did
body:
I attended the emergency department this evening following the advice from my GP. I was initially welcomed by the nurse exploring why I was there and then asked I clerk myself in which I did and the receptionist was very warm and helpful and asked me to take a seat.  
The triage nurse called me in and it went drastically down hill from there! . The nurse asked me why I was in ED this evening I attempted to answer the question but failed to do so as the nurse spoke over me every time and said there’s nothing we can do for you here this evening you have a long term condition! I advised her I knew that as did my GP who sent me to ED following a discussion with a Dr at NHSFV.  
The nurse then stated that’s I should tell the Dr exactly what I told them and take a seat outside and wait on the Dr implying it could be a while despite there being only 2 other people in ED. I am very upset and sad to be writing this as I worked in NHS FV for 21 yrs and was always proud to work for NHSFV and the values and culture we all encouraged and upheld until this evening my experience was awful the nurse appeared in a rush, disinterested and dismissive of my pain which made me feel I was an inconvenience, there was no compassion, warmth, person centred care whatsoever despite being in significant pain! . I am a nurse myself and I have always been proud of my profession however this evening I am sitting at home very upset and sad to have received the care I did.

author: Camp83
title: Need not have worried
body: Positive RVH Paeds Outpatients experience. Daughter had her first appt with Renal Consultant yesterday. She is on the autistic spectrum and I had concerns that she would be overly anxious attending. Need not have worried. Nursing staff where brilliant, engaging with her in a relaxed and friendly manner. Consultant was fantastic-put us both at our ease, reassuring and kind. Thank you

readBy.name: Belfast Health and Social Care Trust

author: Icy dicey
title: Fracture clinic and X-ray dept
body:
As an outpatient at the above clinic, I have made 3 visits over the last 2 weeks.  
Each time I have found the staff to be polite, courteous and cheerful...which cannot be easy, especially in these trying times. Even on yesterday, when I was the last patient to be seen, during a very busy clinic.....yes, lots of us have slipped on the ice !!  
The consultant Ms. Short, was very good in taking time to answer my questions fully and explain options and possible outcomes.  
Great customer care and very much appreciated !  
Thank you all for your help and well done NHS.

readBy.name: Office of Colin Smyth, MSP for South Scotland

author: Heidi17
title: Pacemaker implant
body:
I recently had a Pacemaker device fitted at the Day Theatre Queen Elizabeth Hospital Glasgow; I was very well looked after by many nurses and Dr Corcoran  
who performed the operation. There is one nurse who really went the extra mile for me she is the QEUH Cardiology Nurse Practitioner Caroline. Caroline spoke to me and completed my pre-operation assessment on the phone and I was lucky enough to meet her whilst waiting for my discharge letter and tablets. And she managed to sort everything out for me so I could catch my pre-arranged lift home. I just want to say, thank you Caroline.

author: phaseqk85
title: The support she provided me with
body:
When I had my baby in June 2020 I really struggled with breast feeding and was very relieved to find out that, despite Covid, the Breast Feeding Support team were permitted to visit new mums in their homes. Having just had a baby, especially due to the pandemic, I was feeling quite vulnerable and isolated and very concerned about how I was going to resolve the feeding issues I was experiencing. Colette from NHS Fife Breastfeeding Support team went over and above to help me persevere for many weeks until we managed to establish effective breast feeding. Colette was so patient, understanding and reassuring and gave me the confidence to keep trying whilst at no point making me feel that I should continue if I wanted to move on to formula. She frequently checked in on us and popped in (when I know she was really busy supporting other new Mums too) to offer some additional advice and support.  
7 months on, I am still exclusively breast feeding my baby. There is no doubt in my mind that I would have given up and moved my baby on to formula within the first month of her life if it wasn’t for the support Colette provided me with. Her support was completely invaluable.

author: Senior medic
title: COVID-19 vaccination appointment
body: I am a front line health care professional and whilst waiting for vaccination at my hospital I was contacted by Shore Medical with a short notice appointment. Within 10 minutes I was in the surgery and vaccinated with my wife who is also a front line health care professional. The staff were unfailingly pleasant despite a significant work load and the whole system was highly organised - very impressive!

author: tribpot
title: Excellent care
body: Dr Jones is treating my teenaged son for an ongoing condition.   We have met with her in person once and over the phone several times and each time she has been excellent - striking exactly the right note with my son to reassure him and providing clear and precise advice.

title: Weak Practice
body: I spent 42 minutes on hold only to be told to ring in the morning. I started the call at number 10 in the queue. My call was over inside a minute so why did it take 41 minutes to deal with the other 9 people in front of me!

title: Great set up
body: Had my COVID 19 vaccination today. The whole set up was fantastic and well organised. The staff were friendly and professional. Well done

readBy.name: The Dudley Group NHS Foundation Trust

title: Frienly Practice
body:
Congratulations on your vaccination program, very efficient and handled by friendly staff, thank you.
Gerald and Heike Brinkmann

title: excellent care and service
body:
Received Covid  jab Mon 11 staff were very professional, efficient ,
caring and kind while working under great pressure. All staff front line nand backroom deserve  GREAT THANKS.

title: corona virus vaccine by Pfizer
body:
Service was excellent. was called a day earlier by my GP, obviously i accepted the offer and drove straight to Lane End surgery, was guided in, checked for eligibility, all was good, got the vaccine rested for 15 minutes and drove home.The service was fast, efficient and very friendly really great service by all the doctors and staff.
Have to add that the surgery has been amazing throughout this pandemic always easy to contact by telephone and caring sympathetic response from doctors, nurses and receptionists. 

Thank you so much


Monica and Israel Gefen

author: StressedParent
title: Unorganised and lacking
body:
My daughter has been waiting for help for her mental health issues. We accessed CAMHS in November and are awaiting intervention.  
For the first appointment we were waiting over 30mins for staff to arrive. They got the wrong staff mixed up and seemed like my daughter was not on the list of appointments or that they had forgot. During the appointment my daughter said she felt belittled and mocked by the nurse. Saying some awful comments to her. With no understanding or regard of her autistic difficulties.  
During crisis team phone calls my daughter is told someone will ring back but never do. We have to constantly chase up calls to get support or appointments. This week we went for her weekly appointment with her caseworker. Only to be left waiting 25mins for the nurse to come and tell us the caseworker was off ill. Apparently the caseworker was told to contact us but I did not receive any information on this. The nurse claimed the caseworker had tried to ring but I must of been on another call?! I stated that I had not been on my phone that day! The nurse was condescending and patronising in tone and asking my daughter if she wanted to make a complaint and to go and enjoy the sunshine! This wasted journey could of been prevented. We felt neglected and frustrated. Still no correspondence from the caseworker or any rescheduling of an appointment!Today was my daughters choice appointment with the doctor so my daughter can access community CAMHS which was a video appointment that we had waited a month for! We were waiting for 30mins in the Microsoft Teams meeting and no answer. I rang CAMHS and the receptionist said she’s emailing the doctor and should hear something soon. Again we feel neglected, upset and unable to get any sufficient support. The service has been unorganised and lacking.

readBy.name: Imperial College, BSc Humanities, Philosophy & Law (2022)

title: No duty of care!
body: As with others - of course we appreciate we are living in terrible times - but there are other illnesses which need to be considered.  My partner was taken to A&E back in June he still has symptoms (I won't go into too much detail), but one symptom is a swelling in his lower stomach.  He had an ultrasound which showed nothing (of course).  When you call the Practice for the results all they suggest is to complete the e-consult again - to what end!  They advised the Drs aren't seeing anyone - why not?  I can only presume their Drs are working at the local hospitals - but they don't tell you that - just say they are not seeing anyone.  They seem happy to push all the regular patients on to the local hospitals - who are over-whelmed as it is.  So what to do now?  A friend suggested Livi which is an online GP service for which you pay a £30 fee but at least you get to see a GP on a video call.  We really are at our wits end!   I haven't mentioned the appalling service from the Receptionists (which is not new) as everyone has!

author: jivezc35
title: Amazing care
body:
I was referred to the Ophthalmology Department by my Optician as my right eye was going inwards intermittently. It took me a few Opticians/Doctors appointments form to be referred as when I had gone to the appointments - it was said that they were unsure what to put on the referral as they could not see any evidence of my eye going inwards and no physical need to be referred for specialists opinion. This made me feel not heard, not believed and like I was over-exaggerating or worse, making it up.  
Finally I got referred and My consultant was Mr. Kostakis at DRI. When I met with Mr. Kostakis, I immediately felt listened to and reassured. Mr. Kostakis took his time with the appointments I had and was able to give full explanation to what I was experiencing. Mr Kostakis impression/diagnosis was that I had a Convergence Spasm which is rare - I felt relief that he knew what my issue was straight away, he had a good knowledge of the research and was able to start an evidence-based treatment plan from my first visit. Mr. Kostakis kept me thoroughly informed throughout my treatment. Mr. Kostakis would explain and give me options of what the next steps would be and he gave me choice and it was shared decision making which is something I find really beneficial in healthcare. Mr. Kostakis would take a holistic approach to my care and treatment and always put me at ease in appointments. From being in the waiting room and observing Mr. Kostakis with his younger patients his "bedside" manner was amazing, engaging and absolutely professional.  
Overall, my experience was the best that it could have been and if I ever needed any more intervention regarding my eye - I know I would be in safe, knowledgeable and compassionate hands. Thank you Mr. Kostakis!

readBy.name: Doncaster and Bassetlaw Teaching Hospitals NHS Foundation Trust

author: Maisiemoo1
title: Getting a place
body: I was homeless with my dog and the nurse called sue helped me find somewhere for me and my dog and I can't thank her enough for helping me out

author: octoberrh77
title: Inpatient Care on Ward 210
body:
I was referred to the gynae department at the Royal Infirmary at the end of October because of a mass on one ovary. I had been already been in severe pain for a couple of months and was concerned that there would be a long delay for treatment or that my worries would be brushed off. But the doctors and nurses I spoke to were incredibly helpful and reassuring. I was immediately referred to a surgical consultant and not long after scheduled for a laparotomy.  
The staff on the ward before and after my surgery were friendly, attentive and made me feel well looked after, which was very welcome since it was my first surgery and because of covid-19 I wasn't able to have my partner or my family there with me. I'm very grateful for the care they gave me.

title: Good practice at hospital
body: I was able to book an appointment for blood test to suit me online. On arrival stopped at door, provided with mask to replace one I was wearing and sanitiser on hands rather than on my nitrile gloves. Temperature taken and quickly called for test. Had to go out a different way. All very good but had to go back in for car parking charge. However people were distancing and being checked at door, asked to wait etc so it was reassuring.

readBy.name: The Dudley Group NHS Foundation Trust

author: Ragamags
title: Aberdeen pain clinic
body: I suffer from fibromyalgia and have had such chronic pain in my back waited 2 years for app due to circumstance have been getting worse so was issued with wheelchair but according to pain clinic it is athritis as the pain goes shooting down to my knee so on tramadol pregabalin nuproxen ect have heart condition long qt 1 but asked for injection in back to relieve pain they said they could not give me anything else oh sorry a tens machine still waiting any ideas if injections would ov got my mobility back

title: Impressive response in current circumstances
body: I would really like to thank the GP who unfortunately I cannot name in this review for phoning me so promptly yesterday after my routine blood test to say that part of it was unusual and needed futher investigation. Although she was doubtless very busy she took time to explain, listened to me calmly and arranged for me to be seen at Russells Hall AEC calling me back to ask me to go as soon as I could. Fortunately there turned out to be no further problem and I am very grateful I didn't have to wait for days/weeks.

author: lotionpx99
title: COVID-19 vaccination clinic
body:
My dad, who is 81, attended Meadowgreen Health Centre for his first Covid-19 vaccination. It took place at a venue that was unfamiliar to him. He was so impressed with the organisation that had gone into making the whole experience a positive one, that he wanted me to pass on his compliments to all staff involved.  
Any of his possible anxieties seemed to have been thought about in advance, so that the whole experience on the day was a very positive one. From the moment he stepped out of the taxi he was taken care of. Staff had obviously put in a lot of work to set up an excellent system. His thanks go to everyone at the surgery & behind the scenes.  
As a daughter living some distance away & unable to visit due to Shielding from Covid-19, it has been lovely to hear him enthuse about the whole experience. It has been reassuring to me to know that you have taken such care of him. Your website has been very informative & enabled me to let him know when he should ring the surgery.  
At a time when medical services are being stretched in all directions, please know that all your efforts for your patients are very much appreciated. Thank you all.

readBy.name: Sheffield Teaching Hospitals NHS Foundation Trust
Meadowgreen Health Centre & The Avenue Medical Practice

author: Gibby33Karate0110
title: Issues with my blood
body:
I wasn’t happy that I was kept in for 3 days when my appointment was for 1....  
I was pleasantly surprised when they found issues with my blood and they sorted it out so a huge thanks.

title: Fantastic Doctor's
body: I was a little rude to a receptionist and I would firstly like to send my apology to her. I was frustrated as for 10 days of trying to speak to a doctor I was told ring back tomorrow at 9am and then when I finally got through I was told to phone back at 2pm and this went on for 2 full weeks, I had no medication and the receptionists just kept saying they are full. I didn't feel anyone was listening and I was very rude but I just didn't know what to do, I'd start phoning 5 minutes before 9am and the answer phone was still on until they answered around 9.20am and it was the same thing at 2pm. I felt all I needed was something for a chest infection but like I said no one was listening. I do understand all the pressure the surgery and staff are under and I think staff, doctors and nurses at this surgery are second to none and I rate you all very highly, but please also understand I have been terrified about my breathing for a few years before this covid-19 started to spread and I know I'm not a doctor but I do know when I have a chest infection  and need help. All I'm asking is please stop making appointments a telephone lottery, I was really scared and just needed my inhaler topped up and something for my chest. In the past and all through this pandemic I've not bothered the surgery and not phoned when maybe I should have but knew there was probably in more need than myself, but this time I did just need 2 minutes and lost it, sorry again for my behaviour. 9.5 out of 10 and the viruses fault that its not 10 out of 10

title: Covid vaccine attendance
body:
I was invited to the practice as an NHS staff member on a last minute vaccine place.
Very impressed with the whole process of the way the clinic was organised from start to finish.

title: Superb service
body: Hi, I had reason to enquire about a medical condition to help with a family issue that is being supported via a specialist geneticist. The practice manager at my health centre was so helpful. All my questions were easily answered and their 'open door' policy rewarded me and, in my opinion, makes health care services readily available. I would like to pass on my thanks to the staff team at the practice. This isn't a one off either. Whenever I have a health issue they always readily assist. Thanks to all especially during this horrid pandemic. You really make a positive difference. PM

title: great practice
body: my wife and i had our corvid vaccination today 14/1/21 we just want to congradulate the practice on its extremley professional manner this excercise was carried out by your staff

title: Fantastic service
body: Attended for covid vaccine. From start to finish the experience couldn’t have been better. Staff polite and attentive at such a worrying time. System in place worked well also.

title: Brilliant
body: This is such a great practice. Lots of different ways to consult. Admin excellent and Drs listen!!! So glad I’m with them.

title: Fantastic Practice
body: Amazing doctor, thoughtful, considerate and very knowledgable, makes you feel at ease, always try’s to get to the bottom of the problem, highly recommended! First class!

title: Very poor practice
body:
My 5 year old daughter had a blood test done at Walter Brice Test centre, Rochester on 30/10/2020. We have been trying to chase the report but we have been told that they do not have the report and we have been redirected to the GP, Darent Valley Hospital several times and they all have informed us that they do not have the blood test results. 
The incompetence of the MCH has left my daughter suffering. Given the current pandemic it is becoming increasingly difficult to secure an appointment with the GP.

title: outstanding
body:
My daughter badly broke her arm and after the disappointing treatment by A&E staff( I understand they are under enormous pressure and appreciate what they are doing  but
  she's only  21 year old and never set foot in hospital and was given no compassion whatsoever and treated like she had broken a finger nail)   very reluctantly she agreed to go back to see  a
 consultant in Fracture Clinic to discuss her options .They were absolutely wonderful and managed to reassure  that they could manipulate her arm back into place and hopefully avoid surgery , she was extremely anxious but the consultant was fantastic and explained everything and made my daughter feel totally at ease.  Big shout out also to the Plaster team who were also great and very reassuring. Big Thank you to a fantastic team.

title: Shocking Administration
body:
Appalling Administration team and the Doctors are slipping up too. The Admin team regularly get things wrong, either they misscommunicate or fail to pass on messages to Medical colleagues and managers. One or two are rather abrupt to patients and trying to get through on the phones (which currently is the ONLY way as the App is worse than useless and the information on it is rarely up to date) and you are left in a phone queue for up to 45 mins when you call for any reason at any time of day. If you are 'lucky' enough to get through and secure a telephone consultation with a doctor it rarely happens when scheduled. It does waste everyone's time if you book a telephone consulation timeslot and a doctor calls you earlier than your appointment (2 hours earlier on one occassion!) which you then miss because you are not expecting it as you may be working yourself, then they don't call again even at the scheduled time! When you do speak to a Doctor who then prescribes you medication, its pot luck if you ever actually get it. Too often the scripts are either not forwarded via the Admin team to the 'Correct' pharmacy or are for the wrong drug entirely! Recently we waited 2.5 months for a medication to arrive only to discover the prescription had been sent to a Medical equipment provider not the patients nominated Pharmacy! Currently we have waited 2 weeks for an urgent medication that should have been dispensed for home delivery from our pharmacy within 48 hours, and we are still waiting for it now into week 3!! Appalling.  
Doctors are all very nice but sadly let down by the admin team, they are also getting medications wrong and it has taken 3 attempts to correct another drug for one of our family members, resulting in an interuption in their medical supply and this causes them other issues. They are also not following up on referrals made, meaning the patient is having to chase everything up themself, this is not good, the patients are the ill poeple and should not have to do this! Unfortuantely the list of issues is getting longer.
Sadly things were not much better before the pandemic with the Admin team but the Doctors were better, because then you could sit in a surgery and observe them process the necessary referrals and check the prescription requests. Now it is sheer luck if you get what you require as everything has to go through an appallingly disorganised Admin team, too many of whom are simply are not up to the job or simply don't care. 
Question "What if I train my staff and they leave?"..... 
Answer " But what of you don't and they stay?"

title: Complicated
body: I rang this morning to be told there are a few appointments with my doctor for tomorrow morning but I will have to ring back at 2 pm which I did and after finally getting through again was told exactly the same but ring again in the morning which will mean another 25 minutes trying to get through. Why couldn’t I have been booked in on the first call all I want to know is weather I have to continue taking one of my tablets tomorrow they’ll say there’s no appointments left what a waste of time.

title: Exemplary practice
body: On Wednesday 23rd December 2020 my wife Margaret and myself Arthur Martin attended and received our 1st Coronavirus inoculation. On Wednesday 13th January 2021 we attended and received our 2nd inoculation.We are both in our late 80’s.The weather on both occasions was dreadful.Heavy rain.Every member of staff has to be congratulated. They were all so caring and professional.

title: Professional and caring
body: Admitted to AMRA B3 11th Jan had the most amazing service from everyone thought it would be a disaster going in but everyone was so caring patient and professional

title: The ambulance crew were exceptionally…
body: Aleyed my fears of heart problems. I have covid and not the best of patients , the crew kept calm and chatted away making me hardly notice the checks they were doing.

readBy.name: South East Coast Ambulance Service NHS Foundation Trust

title: Very Professional and friendly
body:
For two visits in last four weeks to the Oral and facial surgery dept . The appointments  were on time and well performed , professional yet friendly. 
Rather  different to wifes recent  appointment  to dermatology where we had to wait 2 hours beyond our appointment  time for no obvious reason .

title: Well done Petworth Surgery!
body: Just to say a big thank you to you all for all you are doing. I was amazed to get an appointment with you and was so impressed at how it was managed. However I particularly want to say a big thank you to the reception staff and those on the telephone who have been sympathetic, empathetic and so very kind.  It is not the case for many other surgeries I know and I feel very blessed to have such kind lovely people patiently responding to my worries.  And for saying to me ‘yes it hurts - we will do something about it’. THANK YOU.

author: Mrs Scottiedogz
title: Lentigo Maligna
body: Spring 2019 I spoke to GP about a dark patch of skin on my face that had got bigger over 8 years.   Went to dermatology,   then for a biopsy. Confirmed as lentigo maligna.   I was reassured that oral maxillofacial could remove it. Day surgery,   local anaesthetic with sedation.   Surgery November 2019 didn't remove all the affected cells. Further surgery June 2020, pathology showed still affected cells present,   3rd surgery October 2020 still affected cells present.   4th surgery December 2020, on my birthday.   Delay removing stitches due to me catching Covid.   When stitches finally removed Doctor told me pathology completely clear, no further sign of lentigo maligna! No further surgery required.   Although the whole experience was quite traumatic staff in day surgery and in oral and maxillofacial were excellent,   kind, caring,   efficient.   Everything was explained.   I have a follow up appointment in 3 months.

readBy.name: St. Andrews University ScotGEM Medical Students

title: Social Prescriber
body: I had never heard of a social prescriber but she called me after I had spoken with the doctor regarding feeling exceedingly stressed and anxious. She listened to me and was really helpful and positive “prescribing” things to do in the community to help me de-stress. More than anything though it was the sympathetic ear and warm professional support. Immediately put me at my ease! What a great idea!

title: Excellent at a difficult time
body:
I needed good advice after being admitted to Watford General Hospital. The Doctor on my case called me late in the day and by the time we finished I was very much at ease.
Thank you at this difficult time.
Carol

author: Tazzy60
title: A great support to me
body:
I have been taking part in a condition management programme with South Eastern Health and Social Care Trust. We recently had 4 zoom sessions with a Mental Health Nurse and an Occupational Therapist. The sessions were about learning to manage your mental health involving sessions about managing anxiety and depression.  
I found these sessions extremely helpful and I also passed information on to a close friend who also suffers with these conditions. Having depression and anxiety is a daily struggle and the information in the sessions and then sent to us in paper form has been a great help in learning how to cope better.  
Patricia and Rosemary was both so good at understanding how to deal with these conditions, and on many occasions when they talked about how it affects you, I could say, 'that's me'.  
I also speak regularly on the phone with Patricia who has been a great support to me and had made me look hard at certain things that I get very stressed and anxious about.  
I will miss the support I have received when the programme ends soon but it has been invaluable in helping me cope better.

readBy.name: South Eastern Health and Social Care Trust

title: Long wait but good service :)
body:
I had to wait a long time but I did get told they were very stretched. I had lovely nurses who couldn’t have been more amazing, and the procedure was absolutely fine no complications and very limited pain. 
Thank you all from Chloe x

title: Covid Vaccination
body:
Visited St Stephen’s Health Centre with my wife for our Covid vaccinations.
Excellent service, organised and efficient. 
Well done everyone.

title: Very efficient and great staff
body: Came for COVID vaccination, all was carried out very efficiently and with excellent level of service and professionalism from staff and volunteers. Very impressed

author: Marieclaire
title: The efficiency and care was very impressive
body: Had an appointment during Covid to get lump checked on my breast. Very anxious had to go alone so arrived very early. Was seen almost as soon as I arrived. The efficiency and care shown to me by all clinicians was very impressive. Their fantastic system of triage works effectively despite the staff fully gowned with visors and masks which are extremely uncomfortable. Not one of the staff complained.   My worries and lump was their main priority. NHS at their best. I will always be grateful thank you

readBy.name: South Eastern Health and Social Care Trust

title: Caring and professional
body: Had an op and the surgeon was great. The nursing staff were very professional and supportive.  Thank you.

title: Excellent service
body:
Excellent service every time! A very professional and caring practice , keep
Up the great work much appreciated thank you !

title: Worse gp in England
body: Me and my wife moved in Sheffield April 2017 from London. After we moved here we try to sort everything out as part of our new life in a new city so register the gp was one of the part as well. So we went to the go took the form fill it up and send it back to the gp. I never needed to go to the gp since I registered as I am a young healthy man. Recently I was tested positive of corona virus and I was extremely sick and call to 111 and ask medical help . Than they advised me to contact my local gp and a doctor will assist me with further information. Than I call to the gp , after waiting around 15 minutes on the line someone answer my call and ask my details which I gave everything. Do you know what the receptionist answer me after few minutes I was shocked. He said I never been registered with the gp. What a pathetic answer you heard when you risking your life because of COVID and want to speak with a doctor. This is what I experienced. What a nightmare. My wife was pregnant in 2018 she use the gp for her pregnancy reason while we both registered same day same time. When I need the go most in my life they said I am not registered with them. Can you believe it.such a pathetic experience

readBy.name: Sheffield Health and Social Care NHS Foundation Trust

author: caringjt98
title: My experience in 106
body: I was an inpatient in the royal infirmary ward 106 over the Christmas period. I want to thank all the staff who looked after me throughout my time there and helped me. I want to say a massive thank you to one of the most kind, caring, compassionate not only nurses but person I have ever met Hannah. She has made what was a horrible experience being in hospital more comfortable and a positive experience for me. Thanks to you my patient journey was a more positive one. With having a daughter as a nurse I can see how tiring this job can be but Hannah still always had a smile on her face and always approached me with a smile and positive energy. Thank you for everything she did for me and I wish you all the best in your future you will go far. Many thanks

readBy.name: Office of Colin Smyth, MSP for South Scotland

title: Covid vaccination experience
body: I received my first Covid vaccine this evening. I have to admit to  feeling anxious. From the moment I arrived at Holmhurst Medical Centre I felt reassured. I should have taken chocolate. It was late, it was dark and cold and damp and yet the volunter marshals were there as were the HMC staff. I was guided through the building by the marshals, checks were undertaken and information given. When I received the jab it was in an environment of calm, questions were asked, checks were made and I was given the opportunity to discuss any concerns. The injection was painless and then I was guided to a waiting area to sit for 15 minutes being observed by staff in case I felt unwell. Then when I was ready to leave I checked out with the nurse at the exit, just one more question to ensure that I felt well before going home. I am an NHS worker but non the less I feel lucky to have received the vaccine and to be cared for in such an efficint and caring environment. As  I said at the start - I should have taken chocolate, not for me of course but for the workers.   Thank you to all envolved.

title: Realty disappointing service insensitive and rude
body: Went for treatment. Was seen by a member of staff who made me feel uncomfortable and an inconvenience .was absolutely horrified by the way he spoke to me. Never want to go back , but unfortunately with my condition I have too. Left in tears.it really is pot luck who you get. He scared me.

title: Caring practice
body: I have found everyone at this practice to be caring and understanding. They provide top quality service. I have never had any issues and feel they genuinely care - highly recommend this practice.

title: Some good some bad at this practice,
body:
My comments are not to do with my last appointment with my named GP as that was ok and good if can get to see that named person. (See, I'm even having to avoid gender in criteria for my review, not helpful.)

My point is that the practice has gone downhill over the years and can be very uncaring towards the patient if you get the wrong person. I have been there since 1985. June 2018, I was very ill and suicidal and was treated badly, doctor on my emergency appointment argued semantics as to whether I had suicidal thoughts or was suicidal and didn't get me any help. Luckily, a private sector psychologist gave me an emergency appointment and then kept me on and saved me. Roll forward to March 2020 and I had a "don't darken our doorstep" type of text at the start of Covid. I complied despite severe foot inflammation in October and December 2020. I felt the practice wouldn't care as I hadn't had a follow up text saying how to get help. I had a flu injection invite in December which I declined as they're not good for my conditions and got a bossy NHS letter 8Jan almost telling me it was my national duty to have one. Can't they understand my wishes? I am not a number to be bossed about by NHS and a practice I feel doesn't particularly care about me and my welfare. I mainly now pay for private care in order to be treated as a person with needs

author: Rockartmun
title: Care
body:
Dr Machesney at Whips Cross bowel cancer is the most compassionate Dr I have every met. He is clear with explanations too,he got me I to surgery immediately.  
Years after my surgery he remembered my sons name. Which warmed my heart. With the worries of cancer. He certainly will put you at ease, make you feel special and important. This doctor is passionate about his field and breakthroughs in care. I saw him on the news years later.

title: Good doctors
body: Would like to thank the health care assistant fir the care empathy and professionalism shown every time I’ve had to visit, excellent qualities thanks

title: Great practice
body: I am currently a patient in gate 41, all the doctors, nurses, and ancillary staff are excellent, caring, cheerful, nothing is too much trouble for them. The meals are very good with a decent mixed menu. If you find yourself in my position at anytime then you can be assured of careful attention for your treatment at this hospital.

author: Dionnex
title: Kind and Compassionate Nurse
body: I’m going in for a procedure this week and had to attend preadmission at the Western General Hospital. All staff at the preadmission unit were lovely and welcoming. I was seen by a kind nurse called Yolonde (I think that’s her name) she was very supportive and understanding. I felt at ease when I was speaking with her as I was a bit anxious about the procedure I was having and she explained things fully to me. She also understood about endometriosis which is the condition that I have and was knowledgable on it which made such a difference because the last few months have been so bad due to symptoms getting worse. It may seem like nothing to some people but her kindness and understanding really helped especially at quite a stressful time. I am grateful to her and I hope that someone can pass this feedback onto her.

title: first class care
body: didn't visit I had phone appointment and can not praise highly enough. the doctor rang me and already had my prescription electronically sent to pharmacy. I have been with this health centre for a lot of years and have always respected all staff inclusive if the receptionists who keep the surgery running with efficiency. the patient is always in good hands and well cared for. the doctors *all of them* can readily recognise any problems and swiftly act upon then in an instance . they certainly had a concern upon seeing my husband and immediately had called an ambulance ;so when people complain about having to wait a little longer whilst in the surgery for their appointment I feel it's really not necessary given that timescales sometimes are inevitable and something we should respect. I like many others have the utmost respect for everyone at the health centre .professional kind non judgemental. and in particular with the recent overload of work due mainly to the covid concerns they are doing a great job and are well prepared with the website for us to access; this takes some pressure away with needless appointments of non urgent matters. well done and thank you for keeping us safe not just through current events but also for all the years if service you have to an us. it .ca not be easy for you all but you are very much appreciated.

title: Worst place ever
body: I have never ever encountered anything like that before. They don’t give you an appointment and ask you to call at 8am to get an appointment on the day, so you can try to stay on the phone and wait ages to speak to the receptionist who is the rudest person ever, talking down on you! By the way people do work and calling at 8am to get appointments on the same day is not what can everyone afford especially when you don’t work locally. Unfortunately due to their lack of care I have had to sign up to an online GP should I get Ill or rather call 111! This place is an absolute disgrace no organisation neither basic care. Do not sign up there and direct yourself to a decent GP. I understand that most of the GP have been overwhelmed with the current pandemic but those issues have been ongoing for far too long way before this situation.

author: Greig47
title: Day Surgery
body:
Excellent level of care from David and Laura BAU Contingency Surgical Skin Team.  
Procedure was fully explained prior to being carried out and I was kept informed as procedure progressed.  
Whole experience was swift, painless and stress free.

author: antliawq49
title: The numbers don't work
body:
My GP sent me this slip, this form with two Manchester numbers to ring so I can contact 6 degrees. Its so I can register for the psychological wellbeing practitioners, the idea is I get six to eight consultations -trouble is, the numbers don't work.  
It gives the numbers here and says to call between 8:30-4:30 Monday to Friday, which is when I'm calling - but the phone just says number not recognised or invalid number.

title: So Professional and Caring
body: From arriving to leaving, the whole experience of attending hospital for day surgery, especially during Covid, was made all the more easier by the professional and caring staff. Nothing was too much trouble for them and they made my short stay so less stressful. All the staff I met from admin staff at reception, to nurses and my surgeon were so kind, friendly and utterly professional.

author: Daisyx
title: Support received from Bereavement Service
body:
I contacted the GM Bereavement Service on the advice of my GP because I was struggling to function and cope after losing my Dad which was made worse by the pandemic and the circumstances in which it happened.  
The tipping point for me to ask for help was having my first panic attack which was frightening mentally and surprisingly physical. Before I had the panic attack I could never have understood what people meant about anxiety and didn't believe I was the sort of person who would ever suffer from something like that.  
I was contacted by a lady from the Bereavement Team and felt able to talk openly and freely about how I was feeling. I'm not normally the sort of person who opens up to strangers easily and I do have friends and family that have tried to do everything they can but there are things that I felt more comfortable saying to a stranger.  
The lady who rang me was amazing - non judgemental, supportive and caring - she called me regularly and listened to me and let me cry. She gave me links and resources to different places to learn about some coping mechanisms that might work for me and most importantly was able to give me the information I needed to access some specialist counselling.  
My head was such a mess after my Dad died - without this service I truly believe I would still be in a mess as I didn't have the motivation or clear headedness to think properly for a while. I had slipped into a routine of withdrawing from people around me and drinking too much to get to sleep.  
Having the comfort of knowing that there was someone there checking up on you, making sure you're OK and checking that plans are being followed up and helping access formal counselling was invaluable to me.  
It must be a hard job to listen to people in my situation or worse and still be able to maintain such a caring persona.  
Thank you to this support worker and everyone else at the Bereavement Team. In my opinion your services are invaluable.  
Though I hope I don't need to access anything like this anytime soon and I hope that no-one I know does either, if it is needed this service would be the first I recommend.  
You put me on the right track to be able to deal with my loss in as best way as I can.

author: Happy volunteer
title: Friday meditation group
body:
All week I look forward to Amanda’s meditation group, it always makes me feel so uplifted and ready for the week ahead. It’s lovely to connect with other volunteers and S/U and I know everyone gets so much from it.
Thank you Amanda and Rachel.

readBy.name: Imperial College, BSc Humanities, Philosophy & Law (2022)

title: OUTSTANDING..
body:
I had never heard of Woodthorpe Hospital, until the N H S sent me, all I wanted was for someone to look at my right knee, from the very start I knew I was never going to be disappointed, and to the days before and after my total  right knee replacement I was made to feel so special, the staff were fantastic from walking into the reception , bloods, Covid check, ward 1, theatre staff, doctors, and  to be absolutely honest I have nothing but admiration for everyone.
The private room was great [ room 6] the care I received was and is beyond words other than a massive THANK YOU.
I have no hesitation in recommending this hospital..many thanks once again Barry Spikings.

title: covid jab
body: very good service   from start to finish.   staff  very polite and efficient. The centre was  very well prepared to receive the patients and the  for covid set-up  a perfect arrangement for the task.  Congats to all involved.

author: Mendota
title: Excellent venesection service
body:
I live in Dunblane and have been attending the Day Medicine for scheduled venesections for a number of years now such as to control the iron level in my blood.  
My programme began at the day medicine at the old Stirling Infirmary and has since moved over to Forth Valley Royal. I have seen many changes, some good and some not so good. One constant has been the high quality of attention and service by the nursing team, excellent.  
The current set-up of a dedicated venesection consultation room at Forth Valley Royal run by nurse Cathy is exceptional. This set up is marvellous and most efficient, and a credit to whoever thought of a dedicated venesection department. Even more credit to management for supporting it!  
Appointment wait time is around 3-4 weeks, which is excellent in itself, but the real plus is that the are seldom any delays to the actual appointment time on the day. Separating out venesections from Day Medicine avoids delays on the day. These delays often resulted in me waiting over an hour whereas now I seldom wait at all and if I do, it is only 5 minutes or so. Long may the current set-up remain!  
I would also like to call out nurse Cathy for her professionalism, she is a credit to the NHS.

readBy.name: St. Andrews University ScotGEM Medical Students

author: Grateful_Mama
title: More than I could have hoped for
body:
Our baby boy was born at Musgrove at the end of December. From the moment I arrived in labour at the Triage Ward to when we were discharged from the Fern Ward 5 days later I cannot fault the care I received.  
My birth experience at the Bracken Centre was more than I could have hoped for. I was lucky enough to give birth at this fantastic facility and to have two outstanding midwives take care of me during the course of my labour - Pollyanna and Elenor.  
They were absolute superstars in encouraging me and making me feel confident and safe.  
Unfortunately my baby and I both went on to have a few complications after the birth which resulted in our extended stay.  
Every single member of staff went above and beyond to make us comfortable.  
I felt well informed and in the safest hands for the care we both needed.  
Unfortunately a week after being discharged our little boy was having some breathing issues. We took him to the A&E department where we were seen immediately by a team of fantastic nurses and doctors.  
We were placed in a quiet side room from the time of our arrival and I felt reassured with all the Covid safely measures they had in place.  
We were then admitted to Acorn ward for some further tests and observations. The kindness and the positivity we got from the wonderful team of doctors and nurses here was fabulous.  
Our stay was unfortunately longer than we had hoped for but only because the doctors left no stone unturned when looking into the issues our baby was having.  
For a hospital under so much pressure with the current situation we received outstanding care.  
This is a team of hard working, fantastic medical staff who are a credit to the NHS.  
In the nicest possible way I hope we are not required to go back anytime soon - but I know if we do the treatment and care we will receive will be first class.  
Thank you Musgrove, you are all amazing!

author: Juney66
title: the service received as an inpatient
body: Having been admitted to the Royal Alexandra Hospital (Paisley) in December, I have to say ward 4 staff were absolutely on the ball, the nursing staff were very professional yet friendly, catering and cleaning staff were spot on too. I had appointments (for bloods and scans) elsewhere and mentioned this to staff who spoke to the relevant people and I got both bloods and scan done during my stay, which was much appreciated indeed. I then get a very detailed letter (Mr John Graham, consultant urologist) about my kidney stone (size, position,renal function etc) which was very much appreciated also, there is nothing worse than not being informed directly of something that is going on and will affect you, and whether it was Mr Graham or my GP Dr Thomson (Mirin medical practice) thank you. Keep up the good work you are appreciated.

readBy.name: St. Andrews University ScotGEM Medical Students

author: the doc
title: Getting better after a stroke
body:
Thank you to Rhea and Margaret for all your help and all you have done for me.  
It has been a pleasure meeting you both and I really appreciate your advice and suggestions and all you have done.

title: Responsive care
body: I had a very helpful phone consultation where the GP listened, didn’t hurry me, and where my thoughts on treatment options were discussed properly. This was two days ago and the cream I was prescribed has worked wonders. Thank you so much. Despite the pandemic and huge stressors the surgery must be facing at present, I felt I had equitable, responsive care.

author: K70
title: Care received
body: I had to have a procedure called an ercp, I cannot thank the staff on the ward and in the theatre enough. I felt informed, safe and cared for. I had a similar style of procedure many years before at another hospital that didn't go well so I was extremely anxious. This time due to the experience of Mr Perry and the staff around him there was no issues. I am so grateful. I can't praise the staff in the endoscopy unit at pilgrim hospital enough and the nurse from Grantham hospital.

title: A caring team of doctors
body: My experience has been really positive, with each GP being consistently committed to providing high quality diagnosis and care. Following testing positive for Covid 19 back in November, I have had ongoing symptoms. Each GP I have spoken to has listened carefully and given clear and helpful advice. The team are clearly working long hours under challenging circumstances. I am really impressed by their professionalism and I want to thank each and every one of you for working so hard to keeping us all safe and well. Well done and thank you!

author: Emmqh56
title: Friendly and efficient vaccination clinic
body:
I had my first vaccination on Thursday. I just wanted to compliment the friendly, efficient team involved in this process from check in at the front door, completing the green card, the vaccination to the cheery goodbye.  
I feel very proud and privileged to be an employee of the Trust.

readBy.name: Northern Health and Social Care Trust

author: caelumfm39
title: I cant thank the five of them enough
body:
We had our third baby new years morning .  
We were cared for exceptionally well from door to discharge .  
We were greeted in maternity assessment by Phil and Siobhan , examined and made comfortable, then over to labour ward to Suzanne and Josie. After a speedy delivery with our son, we were looked after so well by both until it was time to go to the ward with Helena. I felt so supported and had a lovely delivery with our third baby, well informed and lovely bonding afterwards.  
I cant thank the five of them enough for all their care, professionalism and especially in the current pandemic, whilst ensuring we both were safe.  
On the ante natal ward the care continued with Wendy and Tracey, we appreciate everything everyone did for us x 😍

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

title: Wonderful New GP
body: I cannot express enough the importance of a GP being able to effectively, naturally and comfortably communicate with Autistic patients.  For my autistic teenage son, yesterday our new GP did exactly that!  For the first time as a parent carer I felt that I did not have to ‘translate’ for my autistic son.  This was all down to the exceptional communication, friendly, incredibly kind and understanding manor of our new GP.  I have never seen my son speak so comfortably, honestly and calmly about his difficulties with a GP or an adult he has never met before.  This is so important for a GP to be able to have this understanding and these skills as my sons health may well have deteriorated over another year had he have not met with this GP.  Due to his natural and confident way of communicating effectively with my son I believe that my son will feel far more at ease when wanting to discuss anything medical in the future.  Thank you so much.  You would have never realised how much you actually made a difference yesterday hence the need to write this review.  Thank you DR HP.

title: Outstanding team, superb surgery
body: This surgery is quite simply a caring thorough and elite team of professionals that looked after my late parents for over 30 years. My father passed recently after a long illness. The doctors always called me back on the phone and never rushed the call offering the time necessary to provide truthful honest and accurate feedback including actions to be taken etc. Both parents always said to me how much confidence they had in their doctors consistently. Appointments were juggled, home visits given often out of hours. They care and that level of service comes from the heart. I thank them. I’m not allowed to mention names but they know who they are. My best wishes.

author: Paula77
title: Massive thank you to ED and ward 107 ARI
body:
I am a nurse myself and last week I became really unwell at home with what turned out to be pneumonia. I was really breathless and scared and the thought of going into hospital was terrifying.  
I would like to say how wonderful each and every member of the team who I met were. They were caring, compassionate and professional and made me feel safe during a very overwhelming scary experience, where I felt at my most vulnerable.  
I wish I could remember everyone’s name and I wish I could thank them all personally but I will never forget their care, kindness and compassion.  
The paramedics and Drs, Nurses and HCSW who I met in ED ARI and Ward 107 ARI were wonderful and I can’t thank them enough.  
Thank you all so much from the bottom of my heart! You are all amazing (especially during these challenging times!).  
Proud to be NHS.

readBy.name: St. Andrews University ScotGEM Medical Students

title: Exemplary treatment.
body: On 23.12.2020 and 13.01.2021 my wife Margaret and myself Arthur Martin both received our 1st and 2nd Coronavaris vaccination.On both occasions it was pouring with rain.All members of STAFF present were so caring and professional.We are in our late 80’s and would like to thank you all for your dedication.

title: Fabulous nurse!
body: I just wanted to say how lovely the nurse I saw today was! I was very nervous going into my smear test but they instantly made me feel relaxed and talked me through the process, from what they would be looking for, how the smear would be done and what would happen once the test was sent off. I felt extremely reassured. I cannot thank them enough!
